
Intercepted message encrypted using RSA with an unusual modulus. Rumor says both primes are Blum integers. Can you recover the flag? Ciphertext: 1280835237148191974104517599426375988452268259693882702394626775684029872918114889638042014157722432731287301151494713693680731226994161560281142056590356


The flag format is flag{...}
n=9756004167821041932006909383285636395422775855491096769066661095479404852684828167265629532031960551771320084224186664790543388120678536646888409369709921, e=8232808760949268538730517095022487434710715869518338730446661258504744472865647281065235343011724507848191296230106333545035407664824827049756876006081685
The lower 104 bits of p are: 34517138144804921143221590516914200463


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{ez5fr1yw}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1280835237148191974104517599426375988452268259693882702394626775684029872918114889638042014157722432731287301151494713693680731226994161560281142056590356
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=9756004167821041932006909383285636395422775855491096769066661095479404852684828167265629532031960551771320084224186664790543388120678536646888409369709921, e=8232808760949268538730517095022487434710715869518338730446661258504744472865647281065235343011724507848191296230106333545035407664824827049756876006081685
The lower 104 bits of p are: 34517138144804921143221590516914200463

extra_info: p=99845249019971738855375490695555108284398814877120953191816542574004718804879, q=97711250796415744807935665446095661268467277264484222526667126618986472541199, Ï†(n)=9756004167821041932006909383285636395422775855491096769066661095479404852684630610765813144548297240615178433454633798698401782944960052977695418178363844
